c1: Get councillors out in their constituencies and interact with the residents. Find out what the taxpayers want and need most. Find a better way to communicate with the mature population, they don't all have access to the internet and are not on twitter or social media.

Something has to give. We need more jobs for people who don't have a degree but could be trained and be a great asset. So more people can be working. We need lower rent so whatever you need to do like lower property tax or the like it's important as no one is making any money and everything costs so much. Drugs, please help the addicts and the homeless it is not a good look to have one if the richest areas of the ice district and Rogers place right next to hope mission where people are openly doing drugs, sleeping on the ground just destitute its so sad

I would like to see better road maintainece, and much better enforcement of minor traffic violations - we have red light cameras, and speed monitoring, but there are many Edmontonians who do not have functional turn signals, or understand what the lines on the road mean - I have get nearly sideswiped at least twice a week, by somebody trying to avoid a pothole and making an abrupt lane change, or in an extreme case, turning right from the left lane - across my path. As important as red light cameras and speed monitoring are, I think that more attention needs to be paid to unsafe left turns, and staying within designated driving lanes.

I've been stopped by homeless individuals multiple times on a night walk asking me to stay with them to call 211 or if I can accompany them part way because they did not feel safe walking to the location or the call would take upward 30 minutes just to connect so in the rare instance they have a phone, it loses charge to continue the call; as well, they did not feel safe having to be on their phone for that time waiting out at night just for the call to fail

The Valley line LRT system is a disaster and a waste of taxpayers money. No one should be allowed to be three years late with a project and not get fired. Your alder people are to young and don't know how to work together for the greater good of all Edmontonian Your administration gets paid to much (CEO of Epcor) and there are to many people doing the same job. I think a independent audit should be done of all administration positions that pay over $150,000 to see if they are earning their pay. Taxpayers should have more input just like this survey. I hope you make the feedback and results public.

The City can't seem to make up it's mind whether it should have a single identity revolving around the downtown core or whether it can be a collection of small cohesive communities with all essential services available within each small community. Rejuvenating downtown at the expense of other residential communities is a huge mistake. Average people can cope with a minimal number of close contacts (approx 100) and forcing them to identify with and function in larger groups is counterproductive (and not very healthy for them).

I find that the city too often rezones neighborhoods to allow for more people. For example, an area that is zoned for single dwelling houses gets rezoned for an apartment building, not taking the area's opinions into account. It feels like they are only looking for ways to collect more taxes and don't care about the existing families. The LRT is costing so much money and is taking so long, will it be worth it in the end? Homelessness is horrible right now. People are setting encampments up in neighborhoods making residents feel unsafe. Begging in intersections is unsafe and should be policed.

Years ago they aproved West Edmonton Mall and it killed the down town Edmonton which has never come back, they aproved Rogers place which killed the all low cost housing in the old Boyle Street area. which I believe help create a lot of the homelessness we see today. The city planners should learn for this past blunders in the future so as not to repeat over again the same mistakes.

I would appreciate it if the Edmonton would be better at scheduling regular pothole maintenance. I live in an older residential area, and our back alley was laden with potholes. When I phoned 311 to alert the City about the issue, I was told that the city would only fix our potholes if we got sufficient neighbor support and offered to pay for it ourselves. It seems a little ridiculous that even in a climate of rising property taxes, my fellow community members and I are still expected to pay for services that the city should be providing to residents.

The Mayor and current City Council seems very out of touch with what is currently happening in the city. If they spent more time in the community conversing with citizens and using inner-city infrastructure and transit, maybe their eyes would be opened as to how sad the current state of the city really is.  They can't continue to address the tent cities by chasing the inhabitants out of one area because the tents will just move into another area. The City needs to address what the root issues are causing these tent cities to start in the first place. Open your eyes and extricate your heads from your rectums!

There is a perception in the city that the city is not on the side of those who live there. For example, those who operate non-profits and/or societies dedicated to improving things run into more hurdles to getting things done than necessary and find that the city is not always honest in their dealings with these groups. Additionally there is the perception that the city is ruining things for the un-housed population when it clears encampments. It is a tough balance to strike but a frustrating one when members of community service organizations are frustrated with dealing with the city to put it mildly.

Two things I do not feel that the speed limit in residential areas, should be 40 km.I believe that it is teaching kids that they do not need to look for vehicles. that vehicles have to watch for them, it is not the responsibility of the pedestrians. So as they get older, they just go on their with headphones on & texting on their phones without looking up. And leaving Edmonton, for whatever reason, this could do more harm than good. I do not want to see kids get hit by cars, but they have to be aware of where they are, and their surroundings. The second item, is garbage collection. If I am paying for garbage collection (black bin), should they not take whatever is in the bin, not leave items behind. I have tried for a month or so to get rid of some large plastic piece of garbage. It fits in the garbage, but it is still in the black bin. At first I thought it was stuff in too tight, so it did not come out, when the bin was dumped, but the last 2 garbage days, it was not in tightly, so that was not the problem. I have VERY little garbage to go out & still it does not get taken away.

I do not want to see the city expropriate more farm land. I would like the city to invest in producing our own vegetables through hydroponic facilities. I know it would be expensive to produce the heat and light needed to have our own vegetables grown during the winter months, possibly using solar panels. i do not want to see farm land used for putting up solar panels nor wind turbines

Too much time/money spent on 'special interest' groups, be it elite sports (hockey), bicycles, move Lucy, inclusion just for the sake of it when better qualified may be ignored. Museum should never have been moved. We are losing too much to Calgary - ie Edmonton Journal editor is now in C. most provincial announcements from C. 'local' TV news and radio programming - much is from C.

Much better planning and use of resources, not necessarily more money. Current LRT construction is a huge mess with delays and overspending and traffic disruption.Unfortunately I can't see it improving. Bike lanes in a winter city have some importance but not over fixing public sidewalks and other problems. I've seen the way potholes are filled eg not draining the water. Homelessness has become a major problem, complicated by mental and addiction issues with no easy answers. I know this is supposed to be a Provincial issue, but surely all levels could come together and figure it out. How do other countries deal with it? City hall's priorities are a huge, expensive mess and I don't see any end to it. We need much more accountability. It's OUR money and not unlimited!

I understand the need for construction projects and infrastructure upgrades, but wish there was a way to have less of an impact on daily commuters (eg. Stony Plain & 142 blocked off for the whole winter with NO work being done, creating bottlenecks unnecessarily). I also realize there is no easy answer for the issues we're seeing downtown, but it's to a point now that the entire area is completely offputting and personally, I avoid it as much as possible...

I used to go downtown on transit to walk during the winter. I would have a coffee or a light lunch down there. I did not go downtown for about 3 years due to Covid. About 4 months ago, I went downtown by bus to meet a friend for breakfast. We were shocked by the amount of homeless people that were in the inside walkways. It did not feel safe. We had breakfast at the A&W upstairs in Edmonton Center. While we were eating, a woman began screaming obscenities on the level below us. When we went downstairs, we found a large field of blood splattered on the floor. The woman was gone. I looked at my friend and said I don't feel safe, I am going home. He agreed with me. We will no longer go downtown for any reason.

The City of Edmonton is trying to increase the ridership on public transit - LRT, buses. Nothing seems to work, especially now that some Edmontonians feel unsafe. I no longer take public transit to Winspear, Citadel, Art Gallery, Library. I offer an experiment: make all transit completely free for one year. If ridership shows no increase after one year of $0 fares, usage is never going to increase, and the City of Edmonton can abandon all plans for expansion of the LRT. Spend the current Transit budget on keeping the trains running, clean, and safe.
